intro: Sphaerostephanos richardsii, commonly known as the Richards' globe flower, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, globe-shaped inflorescence composed of numerous small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a basal rosette. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
